parse.title: List of CAHIIM-accredited HIM Programs in the United States

text.*:
The Commission on Accreditation for Health Informatics and Information Management Education (CAHIIM) has given full accreditation to the following list of Health information management (HIM) programs in the United States.[1]

Contents

  • 1 Alabama
  • 2 Alaska
  • 3 Arizona
  • 4 Arkansas
  • 5 California
  • 6 Colorado
  • 7 Connecticut
  • 8 Delaware
  • 9 Florida
  • 10 Georgia (U.S. state)
  • 11 Idaho
  • 12 Illinois
  • 13 Indiana
  • 14 Iowa
  • 15 Kansas
  • 16 Kentucky
  • 17 Louisiana
  • 18 Maine
  • 19 Maryland
  • 20 Massachusetts
  • 21 Michigan
  • 22 Minnesota
  • 23 Mississippi
  • 24 Missouri
  • 25 Montana
  • 26 Nebraska
  • 27 Nevada
  • 28 New Jersey
  • 29 New Mexico
  • 30 New York
  • 31 North Carolina
  • 32 North Dakota
  • 33 Ohio
  • 34 Oklahoma
  • 35 Oregon
  • 36 Pennsylvania
  • 37 Puerto Rico
  • 38 South Carolina
  • 39 South Dakota
  • 40 Tennessee
  • 41 Texas
  • 42 Utah
  • 43 Virginia
  • 44 Washington
  • 45 Wisconsin
  • 46 West Virginia
  • 47 References

Alabama[edit]

  • Alabama State University in Montgomery (Bachelor's degree level)[2]
  • Bishop State Community College in Mobile (Associate degree level)[3]
  • Wallace State Community College in Hanceville (Associate degree level)[4]

Alaska[edit]

  • University of Alaska Southeast in Sitka (associate degree level)[5]

Arizona[edit]

  • Central Arizona College in Apache Junction (Associate degree level)[6]
  • Phoenix College in Phoenix (Associate degree level)[7]

Arkansas[edit]

  • Arkansas Tech University–Ozark Campus in Ozark (Associate degree level)[8]
  • National Park College in Hot Springs (Associate degree level)[9]
  • Northwest Arkansas Community College in Bentonville (Associate degree level)[10]
  • University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences in Little Rock (Associate degree level)[11]

California[edit]

  • American Career College in Anaheim (Associate degree level)[12]
  • Brightwood College in San Diego (Associate degree level)[13]
  • City College of San Francisco in San Francisco (Associate degree level)[14]
  • Cosumnes River College in Sacramento (Associate degree level)[15]
  • Cypress College in Cypress (Associate degree level)[16]
  • East Los Angeles College in Monterey Park (Associate degree level)[17]
  • Fresno City College in Fresno (Associate degree level)[18]
  • Loma Linda University in Loma Linda (Bachelor's degree level)[19]
  • Saddleback College in Mission Viejo (Associate degree level)[20]
  • San Diego Mesa College in San Diego (Associate degree level)[21]
  • Santa Barbara City College in Santa Barbara (Associate degree level)[22]

Colorado[edit]

  • Arapahoe Community College in Littleton (Associate degree level)[23]
  • Front Range Community College in Westminster (Associate degree level)[24]
  • Regis University in Denver (Bachelor's degree level)[25]

Connecticut[edit]

  • Charter Oak State College in New Britain (Bachelor's degree level)[26]
  • Lincoln College of New England in Southington (Associate degree level)[27]

Delaware[edit]

  • Delaware Technical Community College in Wilmington (Associate degree level)[28]

Florida[edit]

  • Broward College in Fort Lauderdale (Associate degree level)[29]
    • Note: This program is actually held at the Coral Springs campus of BC.
  • College of Business and Technology in Miami (Associate degree level)[30]
    • Note: This program is actually held at the Cutler Bay campus of CBT.
  • College of Central Florida in Ocala (Associate degree level)[31]
  • Daytona State College in Daytona Beach (Associate degree level)[32]
  • Florida A&M University in Tallahassee (Bachelor's degree level)[33]
  • Florida SouthWestern State College in Fort Myers (Associate degree level)[34]
  • Florida State College at Jacksonville in Jacksonville (Associate degree level)[35]
  • Indian River State College in Fort Pierce (Associate degree level)[36]
  • Keiser University in Fort Lauderdale (Associate & Bachelor's degree levels)[37][38]
  • Lake–Sumter State College in Leesburg (Associate degree level)[39]
  • Miami Dade College in Miami (Associate degree level)[40]
  • Palm Beach State College in Lake Worth (Associate degree level)[41]
  • Pensacola State College in Pensacola (Associate degree level)[42]
  • Santa Fe College in Gainesville (Associate degree level)[43]
  • Seminole State College of Florida in Sanford (Associate degree level)[44]
    • Note: This program is actually held at the Altamonte Springs campus of SSCF.
  • Southern Technical College in Port Charlotte (Associate degree level)[45]
  • St. Johns River State College in Palatka (Associate degree level)[46]
    • Note: This program is actually held at the St. Augustine campus of SJRSC.
  • St. Petersburg College in St. Petersburg (Associate degree level)[47]
    • Note: This program is actually held at the Pinellas Park campus of SPC.
  • Ultimate Medical Academy in Tampa (Associate degree level)[48]
  • University of Central Florida in Orlando (Bachelor's degree level)[49]

Georgia (U.S. state)[edit]

  • Athens Technical College in Athens (Associate degree level)[50]
  • Atlanta Technical College in Atlanta (Associate degree level)[51]
  • Darton State College in Albany (Associate degree level)[52]
  • Georgia Northwestern Technical College in Rock Spring (Associate degree level)[53]
  • Augusta University (formally the Georgia Regents University) in Augusta (Bachelor's degree level)[54]
  • Gwinnett Technical College in Lawrenceville (Associate degree level)[55]
  • Ogeechee Technical College in Statesboro (Associate degree level)[56]
  • West Georgia Technical College in Waco (Associate degree level)[57]
  • Wiregrass Georgia Technical College in Valdosta (Associate degree level)[58]

Idaho[edit]

  • Idaho State University in Pocatello (Associate degree level)[59]

Illinois[edit]

  • Chicago State University in Chicago (Bachelor's degree level)[60]
  • College of DuPage in Glen Ellyn (Associate degree level)[61]
  • College of Lake County in Grayslake (Associate degree level)[62]
  • Danville Area Community College in Danville (Associate degree level)[63]
  • Harper College in Palatine (Associate degree level)[64]
  • Illinois State University in Normal (Bachelor's degree level)[65]
  • Joliet Junior College in Joliet (Associate degree level)[66]
  • Midstate College in Peoria (Associate degree level)[67]
  • Moraine Valley Community College in Palos Hills (Associate degree level)[68]
  • Northwestern College in Chicago (Associate degree level)[69]
  • Oakton Community College in Des Plaines (Associate degree level)[70]
  • Rasmussen College in Bloomington, Minnesota (Associated & Bachelor's degree levels)[71][72]
    • Note: This program is actually held at the Aurora and Rockford campuses of RC.
  • Rend Lake College in Ina (Associate degree level)
  • Resurrection University in Chicago (Bachelor's degree level)[73]
  • Richland Community College in Decatur (Associate degree level)[74]
  • Southwestern Illinois College in Belleville (Associate degree level)[75]
  • University of Illinois at Chicago in Chicago (Bachelor's & Master's degree levels)[76][77]
  • Waubonsee Community College in Sugar Grove (Associate degree level)[78]

Indiana[edit]

  • American National University in Indianapolis (Associate degree level)[79]
  • Indiana Institute of Technology in Fort Wayne (Associate degree level)[80]
  • Indiana University in Indianapolis (Bachelor's degree level)[81]
  • Indiana University Northwest in Gary (Associate & Bachelor's degree levels)[82][83]
  • Ivy Tech Community College of Indiana in Indianapolis and in Fort Wayne (Associate degree level)[84]
  • Vincennes University in Vincennes (Associate degree level)[85]

Iowa[edit]

  • Indian Hills Community College in Ottumwa (Associate degree level)[86]
  • Kirkwood Community College in Cedar Rapids (Associate degree level)[87]
  • Northeast Iowa Community College in Calmar (Associate degree level)[88]
  • Northwest Iowa Community College in Sheldon (Associate degree level)
  • Scott Community College in Bettendorf (Associate degree level)[89]

Kansas[edit]

  • Hutchinson Community College in Hutchinson (Associate degree level)[90]
  • Neosho County Community College in Chanute (Associate degree level)[91]
    • Note: This program is actually held at the Ottawa campus of NCCC.
  • University of Kansas (Medical Center) in Kansas City (Bachelor's degree level)[92]
  • University of Saint Mary in Leavenworth (Bachelor's degree level)[93]
  • Washburn University in Topeka (Associate degree level)[94]

Kentucky[edit]

  • American National University in Louisville (Associate degree level)[79]
  • Eastern Kentucky University in Richmond (Bachelor's degree level)[95]
  • Gateway Community and Technical College in Covington (Associate degree level)[96]
    • Note: This program is actually held at the Edgewood (Kenton County) campus of GC&TC.
  • Hazard Community and Technical College in Hazard (Associate degree level)[97]
  • Jefferson Community and Technical College in Louisville (Associate degree level)[98]
  • Western Kentucky University in Bowling Green (Associate & Bachelor's degree levels)[99]

Louisiana[edit]

  • Delgado Community College in New Orleans (Associate degree level)[100]
  • Louisiana Tech University in Ruston (Bachelor's & Master's degree levels)[101]
  • Southern University at New Orleans in New Orleans (Bachelor's degree level)[102]
  • Southern University at Shreveport in Shreveport (Associate degree level)[103]
  • University of Louisiana at Lafayette in Lafayette (Bachelor's degree level)[104]

Maine[edit]

  • Beal College in Bangor (Associate degree level)[105]
  • Kennebec Valley Community College in Fairfield (Associate degree level)[106]
  • Saint Joseph's College of Maine in Standish (Bachelor's degree level)[107]

Maryland[edit]

  • Anne Arundel Community College in Arnold (Associate degree level)[108]
  • Community College of Baltimore County in Baltimore (Associate degree level)[109]
  • Coppin State University in Baltimore (Bachelor's degree level)[110]
  • Montgomery College in Takoma Park (Associate degree level)[111]
  • Prince George's Community College in Largo (Associate degree level)[112]
  • University of Maryland University College in Adelphi (Master's degree level)[113]

Massachusetts[edit]

  • Fisher College in Boston (Associate & Bachelor's degree levels)[114][115]
  • Labouré College in Milton (Associate degree level)[116]
  • Springfield Technical Community College in Springfield (Associate degree level)[117]
  • Note: Bristol Community College seems to have a HIM program, but the information about it is not available.

Michigan[edit]

  • Baker College in Flint Township (Associate degree level)[118]
    • Note: This program is actually held at the Allen Park, Flint, Flint Township, and Jackson campuses of BC.
  • Davenport University in Grand Rapids (Associate & Bachelor's degree levels)[119][120]
  • Ferris State University in Big Rapids (Associate & Bachelor's degree levels)[121][122]
  • Macomb Community College in Clinton Township (Associate degree level)[123]
  • Schoolcraft College in Livonia (Associate degree level)[124]
    • Note: This program is actually held at the Garden City campus of SC.
  • Southwestern Michigan College in Dowagiac (Associate degree level)[125]
  • St. Clair County Community College in Port Huron (Associate degree level)[126]

Minnesota[edit]

  • Anoka Technical College in Anoka (Associate degree level)[127]
  • College of St. Scholastica in Duluth (Bachelor's & Master's degree levels)[128][129]
  • Minnesota State Community and Technical College in Moorhead (Associate degree level)[130]
  • Rasmussen College in Bloomington (Associate & Bachelor's degree levels)
    • Note: Go to the Illinois section for the identical HIM/HIT program links there. Also, there is an associate HIT program at the Brooklyn Park campus of RC.
  • Ridgewater College in Willmar (Associate degree level)[131]
  • Rochester Community and Technical College in Rochester (Associate degree level)[132]
  • Saint Paul College in Saint Paul (Associate degree level)[133]
  • St. Catherine University in Minneapolis (Associate degree level)[134]
  • St. Cloud Technical and Community College in St. Cloud (Associate degree level)[135]

Mississippi[edit]

  • Hinds Community College in Raymond (Associate degree level)[136]
    • Note: This program is actually held in Jackson.
  • Itawamba Community College in Fulton (Associate degree level)[137]
    • Note: This program is actually held at the Tupelo campus of ICC.
  • Meridian Community College in Meridian (Associate degree level)[138]
  • Southwest Mississippi Community College in Summit (Associate degree level)[139]
  • University of Mississippi Medical Center in Jackson (Bachelor's and master's degree levels)[140][141]

Missouri[edit]

  • East Central College in Union (Associate degree level)[142]
  • Jefferson College in Hillsboro (Associate degree level)[143]
    • Note: This program is actually held at the Arnold campus of JC (MO).
  • Metropolitan Community College in Kansas City (Associate degree level)[144]
    • Note: This program is actually held at the Penn Valley Park campus of MCC.
  • Missouri Western State University in St. Joseph (Bachelor's degree level)[145]
  • Ozarks Technical Community College in Springfield (Associate degree level)[146]
  • Saint Louis University in St. Louis (Bachelor's degree level)[147]
  • St. Charles Community College in Cottleville (Associate degree level)[148]
  • St. Louis Community College–Forest Park in St. Louis (Associate degree level)[149]
  • State Fair Community College in Sedalia (Associate degree level)[150]
  • Stephens College in Columbia (Bachelor's degree level)[151]
  • Note: It seems that Crowder College is no longer providing an associate HIT program here.

Montana[edit]

  • Great Falls College Montana State University in Great Falls (Associate degree level)[152]

Nebraska[edit]

  • Central Community College in Hastings (Associate degree level)[153]
  • Clarkson College in Omaha (Associate & Bachelor's degree levels)[154]
  • Metropolitan Community College in Omaha (Associate degree level)[155]
  • Western Nebraska Community College in Scottsbluff (Associate degree level)[156]

Nevada[edit]

  • Brightwood College in Las Vegas (Associate degree level)[13]
  • College of Southern Nevada in Las Vegas (Associate degree level)[157]

New Jersey[edit]

  • Brookdale Community College in Lincroft (Associate degree level)[158]
  • Camden County College in Blackwood (Associate degree level)[159]
    • Note: This program is actually held at the Camden campus of CCC.
  • Passaic County Community College in Paterson (Associate degree level)[160]
  • Raritan Valley Community College in Branchburg (Associate degree level)[161]
  • Rowan College at Burlington County in Pemberton (Associate degree level)[162]
  • Rutgers University in New Brunswick (Bachelor's degree level)[163]
    • Note: This program is actually held at the Rutgers University–Newark campus of RU.

New Mexico[edit]

  • Central New Mexico Community College in Albuquerque (Associate degree level)[164]
  • San Juan College in Farmington (Associate degree level)[165]
  • University of New Mexico in Albuquerque (Associate degree level)[166]
    • Note: This program is actually held at the Gallup campus of UNM.

  • Alfred State College in Alfred (Associate degree level)[167]
  • Borough of Manhattan Community College in New York City (Associate degree level)[168]
  • CUNY School of Professional Studies in New York City (Bachelor's degree level)[169]
  • Erie Community College in Williamsville (Associate degree level)[170]
  • Long Island University in Brookville (Bachelor's degree level)[171]
  • Medaille College in Buffalo (Bachelor's degree level)[172]
  • Monroe Community College in Brighton (Associate degree level)[173]
  • Onondaga Community College in Syracuse (Associate degree level)[174]
  • Suffolk County Community College in Selden (Associate degree level)[175]
    • Note: This program is actually held at the Michael J. Grant Campus in Brentwood.
  • SUNY Broome Community College in Dickinson (Associate degree level)[176]
    • Note: This program is actually held in Binghamton.
  • SUNY Polytechnic Institute in Marcy (Bachelor's degree level)[177]
  • Trocaire College in Buffalo (Associate degree level)[178]
  • Note: Mohawk Valley Community College seems to have a HIM program, but the information about it is not available.

North Carolina[edit]

  • Brunswick Community College in Bolivia (Associate degree level)[179]
  • Catawba Valley Community College in Hickory (Associate degree level)[180]
  • Central Piedmont Community College in Charlotte (Associate degree level)[181]
  • Craven Community College in New Bern (Associate degree level)[182]
  • Davidson County Community College in Lexington (Associate degree level)[183]
  • Durham Technical Community College in Durham (Associate degree level)[184]
  • East Carolina University in Greenville (Bachelor's degree level)[185]
  • Edgecombe Community College in Tarboro (Associate degree level)[186]
  • McDowell Technical Community College in Marion (Associate degree level)[187]
  • Pitt Community College in Winterville (Associate degree level)[188]
  • Richmond Community College in Hamlet (Associate degree level)[189]
  • Southwestern Community College in Sylva (Associate degree level)[190]

North Dakota[edit]

  • North Dakota State College of Science in Wahpeton (Associate degree level)[191]

Ohio[edit]

  • American National University in Kettering (Associate degree level)[79]
  • American National University in Columbus (Associate degree level)[79]
  • American National University in Youngstown (Associate degree level)[79]
  • Cincinnati State Technical and Community College in Cincinnati (Associate degree level)[192]
  • Columbus State Community College in Columbus (Associate degtee level)[193]
  • Cuyahoga Community College in Cleveland (Associate degree level)[194]

  • Sinclair Community College in Dayton (Associate degree level)[202]

  • Terra State Community College in Fremont (Associate degree level)[204]
  • The Ohio State University in Columbus (Bachelor's degree level)[205]

  • University of Cincinnati Clermont College in Batavia (Associate degree level)[207]
  • University of Northwestern Ohio in Lima (Associate degree level)[208]
  • University of Toledo in Toledo (Bachelor's degree level)[209]
  • Zane State College in Zanesville (Associate degree level)[210]

Oklahoma[edit]

  • Rose State College in Midwest City (Associate degree level)[211]
  • Southwestern Oklahoma State University in Weatherford (Bachelor's degree level)[212]
  • Tulsa Community College in Tulsa (Associate degree level)[213]

Oregon[edit]

  • Central Oregon Community College in Bend (Associate degree level)[214]
  • Oregon Health & Science University in Portland (Graduate Cetificate & Master's degree levels)[215]
  • Portland Community College in Portland (Associate degree level)[216]

Pennsylvania[edit]

  • Community College of Allegheny County in Pittsburgh (Associate degree level)[217]
  • Lehigh Carbon Community College in Schnecksville (Associate degree level)[218]
  • Peirce College in Philadelphia (Associate & Bachelor's degree levels)[219][220]
  • Pennsylvania College of Technology in Williamsport (Associate & Bachelor's degree levels)[221][222]
  • South Hills School of Business and Technology in State College (Associate degree level)[223]
    • Note: This program is also held at the Altoona campus of SHSBT, too.
  • Temple University in Philadelphia (Bachelor's & Master's degree levels)[224][225]
  • University of Pittsburgh in Pittsburgh (Bachelor's & Master's degree levels)[226][227]
  • YTI Career Institute in Lancaster (Associate degree level)[228]

Puerto Rico[edit]

  • Huertas College in Caguas (Associate degree level)[229]
    • Note: This program is taught in Spanish.
  • University of Puerto Rico, Medical Sciences Campus in San Juan (Master's degree level)[230]

South Carolina[edit]

  • Florence–Darlington Technical College in Florence (Associate degree level)[231]
  • Greenville Technical College in Greenville (Associate degree level)[232]
  • Midlands Technical College in Columbia (Associate degree level)[233]
    • Note: This program is actually held at the Airport campus in West Columbia.
  • University of South Carolina in Columbia (Bachelor's & Master's degree levels)[234][235]
    • Note: The bachelor's degree program is actually held at the University of South Carolina Upstate campus in Spartanburg.

South Dakota[edit]

  • Dakota State University in Madison (Associate & Bachelor's degree levels)[236][237]
  • National American University in Rapid City (Associate degree level)[238]

Tennessee[edit]

  • Chattanooga State Community College in Chattanooga (Associate degree level)[239]
  • Dyersburg State Community College in Dyersburg (Associate degree level)[240]
  • National College in Madison (Associate degree level)[241]
  • Roane State Community College in Harriman (Associate degree level)[242]
  • Tennessee State University in Nashville (Bachelor's degree level)[243]
  • University of Tennessee Health Science Center in Memphis (Master's degree level)[244]
  • Volunteer State Community College in Gallatin (Associate degree level)[245]
  • Walters State Community College in Morristown (Associate degree level)[246]
  • Note 1: The American National College in Memphis does not seem to have a HIM program anymore.
  • Note 2: The UTHSC campus seems to allow a student to study directly to the Master's HIM program without having a prerequesite Bachelor's degree.

Texas[edit]

  • Austin Community College District in Austin (Associate degree level)[247]
  • Blinn College in Brenham (Associate degree level)[248]
  • Brightwood College in San Antonio (Associate degree level)[13]
  • College of the Mainland in Texas City (Associate degree level)[249]
  • Collin College in McKinney (Associate degree level)[250]
  • Del Mar College in Corpus Christi (Associate degree level)[251]
  • El Paso Community College in El Paso (Associate degree level)[252]

  • Lamar Institute of Technology in Beaumont (Associate degree level)[254]
  • Lee College in Baytown (Associate degree level)[255]
  • Lone Star College–North Harris in Houston (Associate degree level)[256]
  • McLennan Community College in Waco (Associate degree level)[257]
  • Midland College in Midland (Associate degree level)[258]
  • Panola College in Carthage (Associate degree level)[259]
  • St. Philip's College in San Antonio (Associate degree level)[260]
  • San Jacinto College in Houston (Associate degree level)[261]
  • South Texas College in McAllen (Associate degree level)[262]
  • Tarrant County College in Fort Worth (Associate degree level)[263]
  • Texas Southern University in Houston (Bachelor's degree level)[264]
  • Texas State Technical College in Abilene (Associate degree level)[265]
    • Note: This program is also held at the Harlingen campus of TSTC.
  • Texas State University in San Marcos (Bachelor's degree level)[266]
  • Tyler Junior College in Tyler (Associate degree level)[267]
  • Vernon College in Vernon (Associate degree level)[268]
    • Note: This program is actually held at VC's Century City Center campus in Wichita Falls.
  • Wharton County Junior College in Wharton (Associate degree level)[269]

Utah[edit]

  • Weber State University in Ogden (Associate & Bachelor's degree levels)[270]
  • Western Governors University in Salt Lake City (Bachelor's degree level)[271]

Virginia[edit]

  • ECPI University in Virginia Beach (Associate degree level)[272]
    • Note: This program is actually held at both the Newport News and Richmond (Medical Careers Institute) campuses of ECPI University.
  • Northern Virginia Community College in Annandale (Associate degree level)[273]
    • Note: This program is actually held at NVCC's Medical Education Campus in Springfield.
  • Tidewater Community College in Virginia Beach (Associate degree level)[274]

Washington[edit]

  • Shoreline Community College in Shoreline (Associate degree level)[275]
  • Spokane Community College in Spokane (Associate degree level)[276]
  • Tacoma Community College in Tacoma (Associate degree level)[277]
    • Note: This program is NOT certified by CAHIIM yet, due to the change of degrees from an associate one to a bachelor one.
  • University of Washington in Seattle (Bachelor's & Master's degree levels)[278][279]

Wisconsin[edit]

  • Chippewa Valley Technical College in Eau Claire (Associate degree level)[280]
  • Fox Valley Technical College in Appleton (Associate degree level)[281]
  • Gateway Technical College in Racine (Associate degree level)[282]
  • Herzing University in Menomonee Falls (Associate & Bachelor's degree levels)[283]
  • Mid-State Technical College in Marshfield (Associate degree level)[284]
  • Moraine Park Technical College in West Bend (Associate degree level)[285]
  • Northeast Wisconsin Technical College in Green Bay (Associate degree level)[286]
  • Rasmussen College in Bloomington, Minnesota (Associate degree level)
    • Note: Go to the Illinois section for the identical HIM/HIT program links there. Also, the associate HIT program for Wisconsin is at the Green Bay campus of RC.
  • University of Wisconsin–Green Bay in Green Bay (Bachelor's degree level)[287]
  • Waukesha County Technical College in Pewaukee (Associate degree level)[288]
  • Western Technical College in La Crosse (Associate degree level)[289]
  • Wisconsin Indianhead Technical College in Shell Lake (Associate degree level)[290]

  • Marshall University in Huntington (Master's degree level)[291]
  • Mountwest Community and Technical College in Huntington (Associate degree level)[292]
  • Pierpont Community and Technical College in Fairmont (Associate degree level)[293]
  • West Virginia Northern Community College in Wheeling (Associate degree level)[294]
